info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 4:23AM MST until December 28 at 11:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Lower elevation snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Plateau and Northwest Deserts. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Icy and snow covered roads are possible, especially in the mountain terrain, particularly along Interstate 40, State Route 66, State Route 389, and Hualapai Mountain Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The primary concern will be along Interstate 40 east of Kingman, where up to 3 inches of accumulating snowfall on the roadway is possible. Additional areas of concern include Hualapai Mountain Road, State Route 66 east of Kingman, and State Route 389 from Colorado City to Fredonia, where roadway snow accumulations will result in dangerous travel conditions.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
